thread.title: Directions Promotes Tim Laake to CMO

author: cnbc.com
title: Directions Promotes Tim Laake to CMO
text:
CINCINNATI, March 19, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Directions Research is pleased to announce the promotion of Tim Laake to Chief Marketing Officer. In this role, Laake will be responsible for all aspects of the Directions brand, from its digital footprint to speaking engagements at industry events.
"I am extremely excited about Tim's promotion to Chief Marketing Officer," said company President and CEO, Jim Lane. "His unwavering focus on bringing industry-leading solutions and high-touch service to our clients makes him perfect for the role. With 100% focus on clients, Tim will continue our path of ongoing innovation and insights expertise for years to come."
This latest promotion for Laake comes months after celebrating his 20th anniversary with the company. Previously, he held the titles of Senior Vice President and Group Manager, leading the Restaurant Practice at Directions.
"Over the years, our business has grown successfully by developing solutions to our clients' unique business needs with a high level of customer service," said Laake. "I am thrilled to be taking on a broader role, working across our entire organization to continue listening to our clients and guiding them to strategic insights for our continued growth."
Laake holds a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration from the University of Cincinnati and a Master's in Business Administration from Xavier University. He is an active board member of Michigan State University's Master of Science in Marketing Research Program and is on the Board of Executive Advisors for Xavier University's Marketing Program.
Directions is independently recognized as one of the top business decision insight firms in the nation.
It combines a highly experienced staff with a unique mix of innovative and proven approaches to answer pressing business issues. Directions is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio with regional offices around the country.
For more information, visit directionsresearch.com or follow Directions on Twitter, LinkedIn, or Facebook.
